article:
IOS 17

iOS 17 is a major update to the iOS mobile operating system developed by Apple Inc. It was announced at the company's Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) in June 2023 and released to the public on September 18, 2023. iOS 17 brings numerous significant changes and improvements to the platform, including a redesigned Home Screen, enhanced Autocorrect and text prediction, improved Translation features, and much more.

#Early development

The development of iOS 17 began in late 2022, shortly after the release of iOS 16. Apple's software engineers worked tirelessly to create a more intuitive, user-friendly, and feature-rich operating system. Throughout the development process, Apple released several beta versions of iOS 17 to registered developers and public testers, gathering feedback and making necessary changes before the final release.

#System features

##Home Screen

The Home Screen in iOS 17 has undergone significant changes. Apple introduced a new layout that allows users to customize their Home Screen with more flexibility. The new layout includes a redesigned dock, improved icon management, and the ability to create multiple Home Screens. Users can now easily switch between different Home Screens, making it easier to organize their apps and widgets.

##StandBy

iOS 17 introduces a new feature called StandBy, which allows users to quickly access frequently used apps and features from the Lock Screen. StandBy provides a convenient way to check the time, weather, and other important information without having to unlock the device.

##Autocorrect and text prediction

The Autocorrect and text prediction features in iOS 17 have been significantly improved. Apple's advanced machine learning algorithms now provide more accurate text predictions, allowing users to type more efficiently and effectively. Additionally, the Autocorrect feature has been enhanced to better understand the context of the text, reducing errors and improving overall accuracy.

##Translation

The Translation feature in iOS 17 has been expanded to support more languages and provide more accurate translations. Apple's advanced neural engine enables real-time translations, making it easier for users to communicate with people who speak different languages.

##AirDrop

AirDrop, a feature that allows users to share files between devices, has been improved in iOS 17. Users can now share files more easily and quickly, and the feature now supports sharing multiple files at once.

##Siri

Siri, Apple's virtual assistant, has been improved in iOS 17. Siri now provides more accurate and helpful responses to user queries, and the feature now supports more languages.

##AutoFill

The AutoFill feature in iOS 17 has been enhanced to provide more secure and convenient password management. Apple's advanced encryption technology ensures that passwords are stored securely, and the feature now supports more password managers.

##Accessibility

iOS 17 includes several accessibility features that make it easier for users with disabilities to use their devices. The operating system now supports more assistive technologies, including improved screen reader functionality and enhanced closed captions.

##Networking

The networking features in iOS 17 have been improved to provide faster and more reliable connections. Apple's advanced Wi-Fi and cellular technologies enable faster data transfer rates, and the feature now supports more network protocols.

##System settings

The System Settings app in iOS 17 has been redesigned to make it easier for users to manage their device settings. The app now includes a more intuitive interface and provides more detailed information about device settings.

##Charging

iOS 17 includes a new feature that helps users optimize their device's battery life. The feature provides personalized recommendations for reducing battery consumption and improving overall battery health.

#App features

##Phone

The Phone app in iOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now easily block unwanted calls and messages, and the app now supports more advanced call management features.

##Messages

The Messages app in iOS 17 has been updated to provide more features and functionality. Users can now easily share files and photos, and the app now supports more advanced messaging features, including improved group messaging.

##Journal

The Journal app in iOS 17 is a new feature that allows users to record and track their daily activities. The app provides a convenient way to log exercise, sleep, and other important health metrics.

##Apple Music

The Apple Music app in iOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now easily discover new music, and the app now supports more advanced music streaming features.

##Apple Maps

The Apple Maps app in iOS 17 has been updated to provide more features and functionality. Users can now easily find nearby businesses and points of interest, and the app now supports more advanced navigation features.

##Safari

The Safari app in iOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now easily block unwanted websites and ads, and the app now supports more advanced web browsing features.

##Notes

The Notes app in iOS 17 has been updated to provide more features and functionality. Users can now easily organize and share notes, and the app now supports more advanced note-taking features.

##Reminders

The Reminders app in iOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now easily create and manage reminders, and the app now supports more advanced reminder features.

##Photos

The Photos app in iOS 17 has been updated to provide more features and functionality. Users can now easily organize and share photos, and the app now supports more advanced photo editing features.

##Camera

The Camera app in iOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now easily capture and edit photos, and the app now supports more advanced camera features.

##Weather

The Weather app in iOS 17 has been updated to provide more features and functionality. Users can now easily view current weather conditions and forecasts, and the app now supports more advanced weather features.

##Health

The Health app in iOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now easily track their health metrics, and the app now supports more advanced health features.

##Shortcuts

The Shortcuts app in iOS 17 has been updated to provide more features and functionality. Users can now easily create and manage custom shortcuts, and the app now supports more advanced automation features.

##Miscellaneous

iOS 17 includes several miscellaneous features, including improved iBooks and Podcasts apps, as well as enhanced security and privacy features.

#Security and privacy

iOS 17 includes several security and privacy features that help protect user data. Apple's advanced encryption technology ensures that user data is stored securely, and the operating system now supports more advanced security protocols.

#European Union-specific changes

iOS 17 includes several changes specific to the European Union, including improved data protection and privacy features. The operating system now complies with the EU's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and provides more transparency and control over user data.

##Initial plans to remove web apps

Initially, Apple planned to remove web apps from the App Store in iOS 17. However, the company later reversed this decision, citing user feedback and concerns about the impact on developers.

#Known issues

iOS 17 includes several known issues, including problems with battery life, Wi-Fi connectivity, and app compatibility. Apple is working to address these issues through software updates and bug fixes.

#Supported devices

iOS 17 is supported on several devices, including the iPhone 8 and later, the iPad Air (3rd generation) and later, and the iPod touch (7th generation).

#Release history

iOS 17 was released to the public on September 18, 2023. The operating system is available as a free update for supported devices.

#Reception

iOS 17 has received generally positive reviews from critics and users. The operating system's new features and improvements have been praised, although some users have reported issues with battery life and app compatibility.

#See also

* iOS 16
* iOS 18
* iPadOS 17
* macOS Ventura
* watchOS 10

article:
2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage

The 2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage was the second and final stage of the 2022 FIFA World Cup, following the group stage. The knockout stage began on 3 December 2022 and concluded on 18 December 2022, with the final match between Argentina and France.

Format

The knockout stage was a single-elimination tournament, with each match played as a single leg. If the score was level after 90 minutes, the match went into extra time, consisting of two 15-minute periods. If the score remained level after extra time, the match was decided by a penalty shootout.

Qualified teams

The knockout stage featured the top two teams from each of the eight groups in the group stage, for a total of 16 teams.

* Group A: Netherlands, Senegal
* Group B: England, United States
* Group C: Argentina, Poland
* Group D: France, Australia
* Group E: Japan, Spain
* Group F: Morocco, Croatia
* Group G: Brazil, Switzerland
* Group H: Portugal, South Korea

Bracket

The bracket for the knockout stage was determined by the teams' group stage performance, with the winners of each group playing the runners-up of another group.

Round of 16

The round of 16 featured eight matches, with the winners advancing to the quarter-finals.

### Netherlands vs United States

The Netherlands faced the United States in the first match of the round of 16. The Dutch took the lead in the 10th minute through a Memphis Depay goal, and doubled their advantage in the 45th minute with a Daley Blind strike. The United States pulled a goal back in the 76th minute through a Haji Wright goal, but the Netherlands held on to win 3-1.

### Argentina vs Australia

Argentina faced Australia in the second match of the round of 16. The Argentines dominated the match, with Lionel Messi scoring a goal in the 35th minute to give his team the lead. Julián Álvarez added a second goal in the 57th minute, and Alexis Mac Allister sealed the win with a goal in the 80th minute.

### France vs Poland

France faced Poland in the third match of the round of 16. The French took the lead in the 44th minute through a Kylian Mbappé goal, and doubled their advantage in the 74th minute with a Robert Lewandowski own goal. The Poles pulled a goal back in the 90th minute through a Robert Lewandowski goal, but the French held on to win 3-1.

### England vs Senegal

England faced Senegal in the fourth match of the round of 16. The English took the lead in the 38th minute through a Jordan Henderson goal, and doubled their advantage in the 57th minute with a Harry Kane strike. Bukayo Saka added a third goal in the 65th minute, and the English held on to win 3-0.

### Japan vs Croatia

Japan faced Croatia in the fifth match of the round of 16. The match ended 1-1 after 90 minutes, with Daichi Kamada scoring for Japan in the 43rd minute and Ivan Perišić equalizing for Croatia in the 55th minute. The Croatians won the match 3-1 in a penalty shootout.

### Brazil vs South Korea

Brazil faced South Korea in the sixth match of the round of 16. The Brazilians dominated the match, with Vinicius Júnior scoring a goal in the 7th minute to give his team the lead. Richarlison added a second goal in the 13th minute, and the Brazilians went on to win 4-1.

### Morocco vs Spain

Morocco faced Spain in the seventh match of the round of 16. The match ended 0-0 after 90 minutes, and the Moroccans won the match 3-0 in a penalty shootout.

### Portugal vs Switzerland

Portugal faced Switzerland in the eighth and final match of the round of 16. The Portuguese took the lead in the 17th minute through a Gonçalo Ramos goal, and doubled their advantage in the 51st minute with a Pepe strike. Rafael Leão added a third goal in the 67th minute, and the Portuguese held on to win 6-1.

Quarter-finals

The quarter-finals featured four matches, with the winners advancing to the semi-finals.

### Croatia vs Brazil

Croatia faced Brazil in the first match of the quarter-finals. The Croatians took the lead in the 117th minute through a Bruno Petković goal, and held on to win 1-1 (4-2) in a penalty shootout.

### Netherlands vs Argentina

Netherlands faced Argentina in the second match of the quarter-finals. The match ended 2-2 after 90 minutes, with Nahuel Molina and Lionel Messi scoring for Argentina and Wout Weghorst scoring twice for the Netherlands. The Argentines won the match 4-3 in a penalty shootout.

### Morocco vs Portugal

Morocco faced Portugal in the third match of the quarter-finals. The Moroccans took the lead in the 42nd minute through a Youssef En-Nesyri goal, and doubled their advantage in the 90th minute with a Romário Baró own goal. The Portuguese pulled a goal back in the 90th minute through a José Sá own goal, but the Moroccans held on to win 1-0.

### England vs France

England faced France in the fourth and final match of the quarter-finals. The French took the lead in the 17th minute through a Aurélien Tchouaméni goal, and doubled their advantage in the 78th minute with a Olivier Giroud strike. The English pulled a goal back in the 84th minute through a Harry Kane penalty, but the French held on to win 2-1.

Semi-finals

The semi-finals featured two matches, with the winners advancing to the final.

### Argentina vs Croatia

Argentina faced Croatia in the first match of the semi-finals. The Argentines took the lead in the 34th minute through a Lionel Messi goal, and doubled their advantage in the 39th minute with a Julián Álvarez strike. Alexis Mac Allister added a third goal in the 69th minute, and the Argentines held on to win 3-0.

### France vs Morocco

France faced Morocco in the second and final match of the semi-finals. The Moroccans took the lead in the 27th minute through a Théo Hernandez own goal, but the French equalized in the 43rd minute through a Randal Kolo Muani goal. Kylian Mbappé added a second goal in the 79th minute, and the French held on to win 2-0.

Third place play-off

The third place play-off was played between Croatia and Morocco. The Croatians took the lead in the 7th minute through a Josko Gvardiol goal, and doubled their advantage in the 42nd minute with a Ivan Perišić strike. Mislav Oršić added a third goal in the 90th minute, and the Croatians held on to win 2-1.

Final

The final was played between Argentina and France. The Argentines took the lead in the 23rd minute through a Lionel Messi penalty, and doubled their advantage in the 36th minute with a Julián Álvarez goal. Kylian Mbappé pulled a goal back for France in the 80th minute, and added a second goal in the 81st minute to tie the match 2-2. The Argentines won the match 4-2 in a penalty shootout.

Notes

* The 2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage was the first to feature a third place play-off match.
* The final match between Argentina and France was the highest-scoring final in FIFA World Cup history.

References

article:
Cataract Surgery

Cataract surgery is a medical procedure aimed at removing a cataract, a cloudy lens in the eye that affects vision, and replacing it with an artificial lens. This surgery is one of the most common and effective operations performed worldwide, with millions of people undergoing the procedure every year.

# Uses

Cataract surgery is primarily used to treat cataracts, which can cause blurry vision, glare, and decreased night vision. The surgery can significantly improve vision and quality of life for individuals with cataracts. Additionally, cataract surgery can also be used to correct other vision problems, such as presbyopia or astigmatism.

# Techniques

There are several techniques used in cataract surgery, including phacoemulsification, manual small incision cataract surgery (MSICS), and extracapsular cataract extraction (ECCE). Each technique has its own advantages and disadvantages, and the choice of technique depends on the individual's specific needs and the surgeon's preferences.

## Pre-operative evaluation

Before undergoing cataract surgery, patients undergo a comprehensive pre-operative evaluation to assess their overall health and identify any potential risks or complications. This evaluation includes a thorough medical history, physical examination, and laboratory tests.

### Contraindications

While cataract surgery is generally safe and effective, there are certain contraindications that may prevent a person from undergoing the procedure. These include active eye infections, certain medical conditions such as diabetes or high blood pressure, and previous eye trauma.

### Selection of intraocular lenses

Intraocular lenses (IOLs) are artificial lenses implanted in the eye to replace the natural lens. There are several types of IOLs available, including monofocal, multifocal, and toric lenses. The selection of an IOL depends on the individual's specific needs and preferences.

# Operation procedures

The operation procedures for cataract surgery vary depending on the technique used.

## Preparation

Before the surgery, the patient is given local anesthesia and prepared for the procedure. The eye is cleaned and draped, and an incision is made in the cornea or sclera.

## Anaesthesia

Local anesthesia is used to numb the eye and surrounding area, ensuring that the patient does not feel any pain during the procedure. In some cases, sedation may also be used to help the patient relax.

## Phacoemulsification

Phacoemulsification is a modern cataract surgery technique that uses ultrasonic waves to break up the cloudy lens. The lens is then removed through a small incision, and an IOL is implanted in its place.

## Manual small incision cataract surgery (MSICS)

MSICS is a technique that involves making a small incision in the cornea and removing the cloudy lens through the incision. This technique is often used in developing countries where phacoemulsification equipment may not be available.

## Extracapsular cataract extraction

ECCE is a technique that involves removing the cloudy lens in one piece through a larger incision. This technique is often used in cases where the lens is very hard or dense.

## Converting to ECCE to manage a contingency

In some cases, the surgeon may need to convert to ECCE during the procedure to manage a contingency such as a broken lens or excessive bleeding.

## Closing the wound

After the procedure, the wound is closed with stitches or allowed to heal on its own. The eye is then covered with a protective shield to prevent injury or infection.

# Post-operative care

After cataract surgery, patients require post-operative care to ensure a smooth and safe recovery. This includes using eye drops to reduce inflammation and prevent infection, and attending follow-up appointments with the surgeon.

# Complications

While cataract surgery is generally safe and effective, there are potential complications that can occur during or after the procedure.

## During surgery

Complications that can occur during surgery include excessive bleeding, broken lens, or damage to the surrounding tissue.

## After surgery

Complications that can occur after surgery include infection, inflammation, or dislocation of the IOL.

## Risk

The risk of complications can be minimized by following the surgeon's instructions and attending follow-up appointments.

# Recovery and rehabilitation

The recovery and rehabilitation process after cataract surgery typically takes several weeks. During this time, patients may experience some discomfort, blurry vision, or sensitivity to light.

# Outcomes

The outcomes of cataract surgery are generally excellent, with most patients experiencing significant improvement in their vision and quality of life.

# History

Cataract surgery has a long history dating back to ancient times. The first recorded cataract surgery was performed by the Indian physician Sushruta in the 6th century BC.

# Accessibility

Cataract surgery is accessible in many parts of the world, although there may be variations in the availability and quality of care.

## Europe

In Europe, cataract surgery is widely available and of high quality, with many countries having well-established healthcare systems.

## Asia

In Asia, cataract surgery is also widely available, although there may be variations in the quality of care depending on the country and region.

## Africa

In Africa, cataract surgery is less accessible, particularly in rural areas where healthcare facilities may be limited.

## Latin America

In Latin America, cataract surgery is available in many countries, although there may be variations in the quality of care depending on the country and region.

# Social, economic and environmental relevance

Cataract surgery has significant social, economic, and environmental relevance, particularly in developing countries where access to healthcare may be limited.

# Special populations

Cataract surgery may be more challenging in certain special populations, such as children or individuals with complex medical conditions.

## Congenital cataracts

Congenital cataracts are a type of cataract that occurs in children. Surgery to remove the cataract and implant an IOL is typically performed at a young age to ensure proper development of the eye.

## Higher risk for operations on separate occasions

In some cases, individuals may require cataract surgery on separate occasions, which can increase the risk of complications.

# Other animals

Cataract surgery is also performed in other animals, such as dogs and cats, to improve their vision and quality of life.

# See also

* Cataract
* Intraocular lens
* Phacoemulsification
* Extracapsular cataract extraction

# Notes

This article is a comprehensive overview of cataract surgery, including its uses, techniques, and outcomes.

Shepherd Building Group

The Shepherd Building Group is a United Kingdom-based construction company that has been involved in various notable projects and controversies throughout its history. Founded in the late 19th century, the company has evolved over time, adapting to changes in the industry and expanding its operations.

# History

The Shepherd Building Group has a long and complex history spanning over a century. The company's origins date back to the late 19th century when it was founded by the Shepherd family.

## Main contractor

Shepherd Building Group began its operations as a main contractor, taking on various construction projects throughout the UK. The company's early success was largely attributed to its ability to deliver high-quality projects on time and within budget. As the company grew, it expanded its operations, taking on larger and more complex projects.

## Manufactured products

In addition to its main contracting business, Shepherd Building Group also began manufacturing various construction products, including bricks, blocks, and other building materials. The company's manufacturing operations were initially focused on supporting its own construction projects, but eventually, it began supplying its products to other contractors and builders.

## Disposal of non-core businesses

In the 1990s, Shepherd Building Group underwent significant restructuring, disposing of its non-core businesses and focusing on its core contracting and manufacturing operations. This strategic decision allowed the company to streamline its operations, reduce costs, and improve its overall efficiency.

# Notable construction projects

Shepherd Building Group has been involved in various notable construction projects throughout its history. Some of the company's most notable projects include:

* The development of the Trinity Walk shopping center in Wakefield, UK
* The construction of the Meadowhall shopping center in Sheffield, UK
* The redevelopment of the Liverpool Lime Street station in Liverpool, UK
* The construction of the Leeds Arena in Leeds, UK

# Controversies

Despite its success, Shepherd Building Group has been involved in various controversies throughout its history.

## Identity behind anonymous emails

In 2012, Shepherd Building Group was at the center of a controversy surrounding anonymous emails sent to the UK's Health and Safety Executive (HSE). The emails, which were sent from a fake email address, made various allegations about the company's safety record and practices. An investigation by the HSE eventually revealed that the emails had been sent by a former employee of the company.

## Hand tool vibration

Shepherd Building Group has also faced criticism and controversy over its handling of hand tool vibration issues. In 2015, the company was fined £100,000 by the HSE for failing to adequately manage the risks associated with hand tool vibration. The company has since taken steps to improve its management of this issue.

## Domain name disputes

In 2013, Shepherd Building Group was involved in a domain name dispute with a former employee who had registered a domain name similar to the company's own website. The company claimed that the domain name was an attempt to pass off the employee's own business as being associated with the company. The dispute was eventually resolved through mediation.

## Employment blacklisting

Shepherd Building Group has also been accused of being involved in employment blacklisting practices. In 2013, it was revealed that the company had subscribed to a blacklist of construction workers who had been involved in industrial disputes or who had raised health and safety concerns. The company has since denied any wrongdoing and has stated that it no longer subscribes to the blacklist.

## Trinity Walk

In 2011, Shepherd Building Group was involved in a controversy surrounding the development of the Trinity Walk shopping center in Wakefield, UK. The company had been contracted to build the center, but a dispute arose over the quality of the work and the company's failure to meet its contractual obligations. The dispute was eventually resolved through mediation.

* Employment blacklisting in the UK construction industry

article:
The black market in wartime France was a widespread and complex phenomenon that emerged during the German occupation of France from 1940 to 1944. The black market, also known as the "marché noir," was a network of clandestine economic activities that operated outside of the official economy, providing goods and services that were scarce or heavily regulated by the authorities. This article provides an overview of the background, development, and impact of the black market in wartime France.

#Background

##1930s: inflation, instability and unrest

The interwar period in France was marked by economic instability, inflation, and social unrest. The global economic crisis of the 1930s had a significant impact on France, leading to high levels of unemployment, poverty, and social inequality. The French economy was also characterized by a large agricultural sector, which was heavily dependent on small-scale farming and was struggling to modernize. The economic instability of the 1930s created an environment in which the black market could thrive.

##Fall of France

In May 1940, the German army invaded France, leading to a rapid collapse of the French military and the surrender of the French government. The German occupation of France was marked by a strict regime of economic controls, including rationing, price controls, and the requisitioning of goods and services. The occupation authorities also imposed a new economic order, which favored German interests and led to widespread poverty and scarcity.

#1940-1941

##Origins

The black market in wartime France emerged in response to the economic controls and shortages imposed by the German occupation authorities. The black market was initially driven by the need for basic goods and services, such as food, clothing, and fuel.

###Rationing and price controls

The German occupation authorities imposed a system of rationing and price controls, which limited the amount of goods and services that could be purchased by the French population. The rationing system was based on a complex system of coupons and permits, which were difficult to obtain and often insufficient to meet basic needs.

###Diversion from official channels

The black market emerged as a way to divert goods and services from official channels, such as the rationing system, and to provide alternative sources of supply. The black market was initially driven by small-scale operators, such as farmers, traders, and artisans, who sought to profit from the shortages and scarcity.

###Clandestine networks

The black market was characterized by clandestine networks of suppliers, distributors, and customers, who operated outside of the official economy. These networks were often based on personal relationships, trust, and reputation, and were difficult to detect and control.

###Hidden stockpiling

The black market also involved the hidden stockpiling of goods and services, which were hoarded and hidden from the authorities. This stockpiling was often done by individuals and businesses, who sought to profit from the shortages and scarcity.

###Grey market

The grey market, also known as the "marché gris," was a type of black market that operated in the margins of the official economy. The grey market involved the sale of goods and services that were not strictly prohibited by the authorities, but were subject to restrictions and regulations.

##Users of the black market

###Privileged French

The black market was used by a wide range of individuals and groups, including privileged French citizens, such as those with connections to the occupation authorities or with access to scarce resources.

###Occupation forces

The black market was also used by the occupation forces, who sought to profit from the shortages and scarcity. German soldiers and officials often used the black market to obtain goods and services that were not available through official channels.

##Public response

###Early condemnation

The black market was initially condemned by the French public, who saw it as a threat to the official economy and to the war effort. The black market was also seen as a symbol of the corruption and decadence of the occupation regime.

###Participation

However, as the occupation continued and the shortages and scarcity worsened, more and more people began to participate in the black market. The black market became a necessary part of everyday life, as people sought to obtain basic goods and services.

###Housewives' demonstrations

Housewives, in particular, played a key role in the black market, as they sought to feed and clothe their families. Housewives' demonstrations and protests became common, as women demanded access to scarce resources and an end to the rationing system.

###Suspicions of hoarding

The black market was also marked by suspicions of hoarding and speculation, as individuals and businesses were accused of profiteering from the shortages and scarcity.

###Official antisemitism

The black market was also used as a pretext for official antisemitism, as Jewish businesses and individuals were accused of profiteering from the shortages and scarcity.

###Public opinion

Public opinion about the black market was complex and nuanced, reflecting the contradictions and ambiguities of the occupation regime. While some people saw the black market as a necessary evil, others condemned it as a threat to the official economy and to the war effort.

###Political opposition

The black market was also a key issue in the political opposition to the occupation regime, as resistance groups and politicians sought to exploit the discontent and frustration caused by the shortages and scarcity.

##Response by authorities

The occupation authorities responded to the black market with a range of measures, including repression, regulation, and propaganda. The authorities sought to control the black market through a combination of police repression and economic incentives, such as the offer of rewards for informers and the promise of better rations for those who cooperated.

#Widespread black market (autumn 1941 to 1943)

##Agricultural black market

The agricultural black market became a key sector of the black market, as farmers sought to profit from the shortages and scarcity of food. The agricultural black market involved the sale of produce, livestock, and dairy products outside of the official market.

##Grey market: direct sales

The grey market also involved direct sales between producers and consumers, bypassing the official market. This type of grey market was particularly common in the agricultural sector, where farmers sold their produce directly to consumers.

##Commerce and industry

The black market also involved commerce and industry, as businesses sought to profit from the shortages and scarcity of goods and services. The black market involved the sale of goods such as textiles, leather, and metalwork.

##Tacit tolerance

By 1942, the occupation authorities had begun to adopt a policy of tacit tolerance towards the black market, recognizing that it was a necessary part of the economy. The authorities sought to regulate the black market, rather than to suppress it.

###No longer immoral

The black market was no longer seen as immoral or unpatriotic, but rather as a necessary evil. The black market had become a normal part of everyday life, as people sought to survive and thrive in a difficult economic environment.

###Nuanced and refocused enforcement

The authorities refocused their enforcement efforts on the most egregious forms of black market activity, such as large-scale speculation and hoarding. The authorities also sought to use the black market as a way to channel goods and services into the official economy.

##Metrics

###Proportion of production

The black market is estimated to have accounted for around 20-30% of total production in France during the occupation.

###Higher and more volatile prices

The black market was characterized by higher and more volatile prices than the official market. Prices on the black market were often 2-3 times higher than on the official market.

###Geographic distribution

The black market was more prevalent in urban areas, where the shortages and scarcity were more acute. The black market was also more common in regions with a high concentration of industry and commerce.

###Beneficiaries

The beneficiaries of the black market were often those with connections to the occupation authorities or with access to scarce resources. However, the black market also provided opportunities for small-scale operators and entrepreneurs to profit from the shortages and scarcity.

#Patriotism (spring 1943-summer 1944)

##Enforcement for the occupiers

In 1943, the occupation authorities launched a new campaign to enforce the economic controls and to suppress the black market. The authorities sought to use the black market as a way to channel goods and services into the official economy.

###Economic pillage and the end of the German black market

The German authorities also sought to exploit the French economy through a policy of economic pillage. The authorities requisitioned goods and services, and imposed heavy fines and penalties on those who resisted.

###Countermeasures and collaboration

The French resistance responded to the new campaign with countermeasures, such as sabotage and subversion. The resistance also sought to collaborate with the Allies, who were beginning to prepare for the invasion of France.

###Milice vs the black market

The Milice, a French paramilitary organization, was particularly active in suppressing the black market. The Milice saw the black market as a threat to the authority of the occupation regime, and sought to eliminate it through repression and violence.

##Fraud and Resistance

###Resistance encouragement

The resistance encouraged people to engage in acts of fraud and subversion against the occupation authorities. The resistance saw the black market as a way to disrupt the official economy and to weaken the occupation regime.

###Blaming the Resistance

The occupation authorities blamed the resistance for the black market, and sought to use it as a pretext for repression and violence. The authorities claimed that the resistance was responsible for the shortages and scarcity, and that it was seeking to profit from the black market.

###End of the occupation

The black market played a significant role in the final months of the occupation, as the resistance and the Allies prepared for the invasion of France. The black market provided a way for people to survive and thrive in a difficult economic environment, and it played a key role in the eventual defeat of the occupation regime.

#After the Liberation (1944-1949)

##Épuration and illicit profits

###Pursuit and punishment

After the liberation of France, the authorities pursued and punished those who had profited from the black market. The authorities sought to confiscate illicit profits and to impose heavy fines and penalties on those who had engaged in black market activity.

###Confiscation of illicit profits

The authorities confiscated illicit profits, and used them to fund reconstruction and development projects. The authorities also sought to use the black market as a way to channel goods and services into the official economy.

##Continued black market operations

###Continued trafficking

The black market continued to operate after the liberation, as people sought to profit from the shortages and scarcity. The black market involved the sale of goods such as textiles, leather, and metalwork.

###Generalized fraud

The black market was also characterized by generalized fraud, as people sought to cheat and deceive each other. The black market involved the sale of counterfeit goods, and the use of false weights and measures.

###Government powerlessness

The government was powerless to stop the black market, as it was deeply ingrained in the economy. The government sought to regulate the black market, rather than to suppress it.

###Towards the free market

The black market played a significant role in the transition to a free market economy in France. The black market provided a way for people to engage in private enterprise and to profit from the shortages and scarcity.

#Historical memory

##Historiography

The historiography of the black market in wartime France is complex and nuanced, reflecting the contradictions and ambiguities of the occupation regime. Historians have sought to understand the black market as a way to survive and thrive in a difficult economic environment.

##Collective unconscious and cultural roots

###Early recollections

The black market has been remembered as a way to survive and thrive in a difficult economic environment. The black market has been recalled as a necessary evil, a way to obtain basic goods and services.

###Marcel Aymé

The French writer Marcel Aymé wrote about the black market in his novel "La Traversée de Paris". Aymé portrayed the black market as a way to survive and thrive in a difficult economic environment.

2022–23 UEFA Europa Conference League qualifying phase and play-off round (Main Path)

The 2022–23 UEFA Europa Conference League qualifying phase and play-off round were played from 7 July to 25 August 2022. A total of 154 teams competed in the qualifying phase and play-off round to decide 22 of the 32 places in the group stage of the 2022–23 UEFA Europa Conference League.

# First qualifying round

## Summary

The draw for the first qualifying round was held on 14 June 2022. A total of 60 teams played in the first qualifying round. The matches were played on 7 and 14 July 2022.

## Matches

The matches were played on 7 and 14 July 2022. The teams were divided into pairs, with each pair playing a home-and-away tie. The teams that scored more goals on aggregate advanced to the second qualifying round.

# Second qualifying round

## Summary

The draw for the second qualifying round was held on 15 June 2022. A total of 106 teams played in the second qualifying round. The matches were played on 21 and 28 July 2022.

## Matches

The matches were played on 21 and 28 July 2022. The teams were divided into pairs, with each pair playing a home-and-away tie. The teams that scored more goals on aggregate advanced to the third qualifying round.

# Third qualifying round

## Summary

The draw for the third qualifying round was held on 18 July 2022. A total of 64 teams played in the third qualifying round. The matches were played on 4 and 11 August 2022.

## Matches

The matches were played on 4 and 11 August 2022. The teams were divided into pairs, with each pair playing a home-and-away tie. The teams that scored more goals on aggregate advanced to the play-off round.

# Play-off round

## Summary

The draw for the play-off round was held on 2 August 2022. A total of 44 teams played in the play-off round. The matches were played on 18 and 25 August 2022.

## Matches

The matches were played on 18 and 25 August 2022. The teams were divided into pairs, with each pair playing a home-and-away tie. The teams that scored more goals on aggregate advanced to the group stage of the 2022–23 UEFA Europa Conference League.

# Notes

* The teams that were eliminated in the qualifying phase and play-off round were transferred to the 2022–23 UEFA Europa Conference League group stage or the 2022–23 UEFA Europa Conference League qualifying phase and play-off round (Champions Path).

article:
Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore
=============================================

Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore is a 2022 fantasy film directed by David Yates and written by J.K. Rowling and Steve Kloves. It is the third installment in the Fantastic Beasts film series and the eleventh overall in the Wizarding World franchise. The film is set several years after the events of the previous film, Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald, and follows Newt Scamander and his allies as they navigate the complex world of magic in the 1930s.

Plot
-----

The film takes place in the 1930s, several years after the events of the previous film. Newt Scamander (Eddie Redmayne) is tasked by Albus Dumbledore (Jude Law) to lead a team of wizards and witches on a mission to stop the dark wizard Gellert Grindelwald (Mads Mikkelsen) from gaining power and control over the wizarding world. Along the way, Newt and his team must navigate the complex world of magic, including the rise of the International Confederation of Wizards and the increasing tensions between the wizarding and non-wizarding communities.

Cast
-----

* Eddie Redmayne as Newt Scamander
* Jude Law as Albus Dumbledore
* Mads Mikkelsen as Gellert Grindelwald
* Ezra Miller as Credence Barebone
* Dan Fogler as Jacob Kowalski
* Alison Sudol as Queenie Goldstein
* Callum Turner as Theseus Scamander
* Victoria Yeates as Bunty Broadacre
* Jessica Williams as Eulalie "Lally" Hicks
* Richard Coyle as Aberforth Dumbledore
* Katherine Waterston as Tina Goldstein

Production
------------

### Development

In October 2016, it was announced that the Fantastic Beasts film series would consist of five films, with the third installment set to be released in 2021. In November 2018, it was announced that the film would be titled Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore. The screenplay was written by J.K. Rowling and Steve Kloves, with Rowling also serving as a producer on the film.

### Casting

In November 2019, it was announced that Mads Mikkelsen would replace Johnny Depp as Gellert Grindelwald in the film, following Depp's departure from the franchise. In October 2020, it was announced that Richard Coyle would play the role of Aberforth Dumbledore in the film.

### Filming

Principal photography on the film began on September 20, 2020, at Warner Bros. Studios in Leavesden, England. The film was shot on location in the United Kingdom and Germany, with filming wrapping up on February 5, 2021.

Marketing
---------

The first trailer for the film was released on December 13, 2021, with a second trailer following on February 24, 2022. The film's marketing campaign included a series of promotional posters and social media advertisements, as well as a tie-in video game and a series of companion books.

Release
--------

### Theatrical

Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore was released in theaters on April 15, 2022, in the United Kingdom and on April 22, 2022, in the United States. The film was released in 3D and IMAX formats, as well as in standard 2D.

### Censorship

In some countries, the film was subject to censorship due to its depiction of gay characters and themes. In China, the film was edited to remove a line of dialogue that referred to the romantic relationship between two male characters.

### Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on June 28, 2022, and on DVD, Blu-ray, and 4K Ultra HD on July 26, 2022.

Reception
----------

### Box office

Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore grossed over $405 million worldwide, making it the lowest-grossing film in the Fantastic Beasts series. The film's box office performance was affected by a number of factors, including the COVID-19 pandemic and increased competition from other films.

### Critical response

The film received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising its visuals and performances while others criticized its storytelling and pacing. The film holds a 47% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 242 reviews, with an average rating of 5.2/10.

### Accolades

The film was nominated for several awards, including a Visual Effects Society Award and a Critics' Choice Movie Award.

Future
-------

In November 2021, it was announced that the Fantastic Beasts film series would be rebranded as a series of films based on the life of Albus Dumbledore, with the next film set to explore Dumbledore's early years. The film is currently in development, with no release date announced.

References
----------

Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is an upcoming American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics superhero team Guardians of the Galaxy, produced by Marvel Studios and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures. The film is intended to be the third installment in the Guardians of the Galaxy series and the 32nd film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU).

#Plot

The plot of Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is still largely under wraps, but it has been confirmed that the film will follow the aftermath of Avengers: Endgame and the events of Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2. Director James Gunn has stated that the film will explore the origins of Rocket Raccoon and the final confrontation between the Guardians and their enemies. Gunn has also confirmed that the film will feature the return of several characters from the previous films, including Star-Lord, Gamora, Drax, Mantis, and Nebula.

#Cast

The cast of Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 includes:

* Chris Pratt as Peter Quill / Star-Lord
* Zoe Saldana as Gamora
* Dave Bautista as Drax the Destroyer
* Karen Gillan as Nebula
* Bradley Cooper as the voice of Rocket Raccoon
* Vin Diesel as the voice of Groot
* Pom Klementieff as Mantis
* Elizabeth Debicki as Ayesha
* Will Poulter as Adam Warlock
* Chukwudi Iwuji as the High Evolutionary

#Production

##Development

###Initial work

Development on Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 began in 2014, shortly after the release of the first film. Director James Gunn stated that he had already begun working on the script and that the film would explore the origins of the Guardians and their relationships with each other.

###Firing of James Gunn

In July 2018, Disney fired James Gunn from the project due to controversy surrounding his past tweets. The move was met with widespread criticism from fans and the cast, who rallied around Gunn and called for his reinstatement.

###Rehiring Gunn

In March 2019, Disney reversed its decision and rehired James Gunn to direct Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3. The move was seen as a victory for the #RehireJamesGunn campaign, which had been launched by fans and the cast.

##Pre-production

Pre-production on Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 began in 2019, with Gunn working on the script and assembling the cast and crew. The film's budget was reportedly increased to accommodate the addition of new characters and plotlines.

##Filming

Filming on Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 began in November 2021 and wrapped in May 2022. The film was shot on location in Atlanta, Georgia, and at Pinewood Atlanta Studios.

##Post-production

Post-production on Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 began in May 2022 and is ongoing. The film's visual effects are being handled by Weta Digital, with Gunn working closely with the VFX team to ensure that the film meets his vision.

#Music

The score for Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is being composed by John Murphy, who previously worked on the first two films. The film's soundtrack will feature a mix of classic rock and pop songs, as well as original compositions by Murphy.

#Marketing

Marketing on Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 began in 2022, with the release of the film's first trailer in December. The trailer was met with widespread excitement from fans and critics, who praised the film's visuals and action sequences.

#Release

##Theatrical

Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is scheduled to be released on May 5, 2023, in the United States and the United Kingdom.

##Home media

The film will be released on home media in late 2023, with a Blu-ray and 4K Ultra HD release confirmed.

#Reception

##Box office

Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is expected to perform well at the box office, with some predictions suggesting that it could gross over $1 billion worldwide.

##Critical response

Early reviews of Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 have been overwhelmingly positive, with critics praising the film's action sequences, visuals, and performances.

##Accolades

Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 has been nominated for several awards, including the Critics' Choice Movie Awards and the Visual Effects Society Awards.

#Documentary special

A documentary special titled " Guardians of the Galaxy: The Making of Vol. 3" is set to air on Disney+ in 2023, which will explore the making of the film and feature behind-the-scenes footage and interviews with the cast and crew.

#Future

Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is intended to be the final installment in the Guardians of the Galaxy series, but the characters are expected to appear in future MCU films and Disney+ series.

#Notes

Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is the 32nd film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and the 14th film in the MCU's Phase Four.

The 2023 Wimbledon Championships men's singles qualifying competition took place from 26 to 30 June 2023 at the Bank of England Sports Ground and the All England Lawn Tennis Club in Wimbledon, London, United Kingdom. A total of 128 players competed in a series of matches to determine the 16 qualifiers for the main men's singles draw.

# Seeds

article:
Tár is a 2022 psychological drama film written and directed by Todd Field. The film marks Field's third feature film, following In the Bedroom (2001) and Little Children (2006). Tár stars Cate Blanchett as Lydia Tár, a renowned conductor and composer, and explores themes of power, identity, and the complexities of the human psyche.

#Plot

The film follows Lydia Tár, a celebrated conductor and composer who is widely regarded as one of the greatest musicians of her generation. Tár is the first female music director of the Berlin Philharmonic, and her talent, passion, and charisma have earned her a devoted following around the world. However, as the story unfolds, it becomes clear that Tár's success has come at a great personal cost.

As Tár navigates the complexities of her professional and personal life, she must confront the consequences of her own actions and the secrets she has kept hidden for so long. The film's narrative is layered and complex, exploring themes of identity, power, and the corrupting influence of fame.

Through a series of flashbacks and dream sequences, the film reveals Tár's troubled past and the events that have shaped her into the person she is today. As the story builds towards its climax, Tár's world begins to unravel, and she is forced to confront the darkness that has been lurking beneath the surface of her glittering façade.

#Cast

* Cate Blanchett as Lydia Tár
* Noémie Merlant as Francesca Lentini
* Nina Hoss as Sharon Goodnow
* Sophie Kauer as Olga Metkina
* Julian Glover as Andris Davis
* Allan Corduner as Sebastian Brix
* Mark Strong as Eliot Kaplan

#Production

Tár was written and directed by Todd Field, who is known for his nuanced and complex explorations of the human psyche. The film was produced by Alexandra Milchan and Scott Lambert, and features a score by Hildur Guðnadóttir.

Principal photography took place in Berlin, Germany, and the film was shot on location at the Berlin Philharmonie and other iconic locations around the city. The film's cinematography was handled by Florian Hoffmeister, who worked closely with Field to create a visually stunning and atmospheric film.

#Release

Tár premiered at the 2022 Venice Film Festival, where it received widespread critical acclaim. The film was released in theaters in the United States on October 7, 2022, and was distributed by Focus Features.

#Music

The film's score was composed by Hildur Guðnadóttir, who is known for her haunting and atmospheric soundscapes. The score features a combination of orchestral and choral pieces, and was performed by the Berlin Philharmonic.

In addition to the original score, the film features a number of classical music pieces, including works by Mahler, Elgar, and Bach. The film's use of music is highly stylized and atmospheric, and adds to the overall sense of tension and unease that pervades the narrative.

#Reception

##Box office

Tár was a commercial success, grossing over $20 million at the box office worldwide. The film performed well in the United States, where it grossed over $5 million in its opening weekend.

##Home media

Tár was released on DVD and Blu-ray in February 2023, and is also available to stream on various platforms.

##Critical response

Tár received widespread critical acclaim, with many critics praising Cate Blanchett's performance as Lydia Tár. The film holds a 92% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 222 reviews, with an average rating of 8.1/10.

On Metacritic, the film has a score of 90 out of 100, based on 43 reviews, indicating "universal acclaim". Many critics praised the film's complex and nuanced exploration of the human psyche, as well as its atmospheric and visually stunning cinematography.

##Additional reactions

In addition to the critical acclaim, Tár has also generated a significant amount of discussion and debate among audiences and critics. The film's portrayal of Lydia Tár as a complex and multifaceted character has been praised by many, who see the film as a powerful exploration of the female experience.

However, some critics have also argued that the film's portrayal of Tár is overly sympathetic, and that the film fails to adequately address the consequences of her actions. Others have praised the film's use of music and its atmospheric cinematography, but have criticized the film's pacing and narrative structure.

##Retrospective lists

Tár has been included on a number of retrospective lists, including The New York Times' "Best Films of 2022" and Rolling Stone's "25 Best Movies of 2022".

##Accolades

Tár has received a number of awards and nominations, including several Academy Award nominations. Cate Blanchett won the Academy Award for Best Actress for her portrayal of Lydia Tár, and the film also received nominations for Best Picture, Best Director, and Best Original Score.

article:
2023 Pakistan Super League

The 2023 Pakistan Super League was the eighth season of the Pakistan Super League, a professional Twenty20 cricket league established by the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) in 2015. The tournament featured six teams, each representing a different city in Pakistan, and was held from 13 February to 19 March 2023.

# Squads

Each team was required to have a minimum of 16 players in their squad, with a maximum of 20 players. The teams were allowed to retain a maximum of eight players from their previous season's squad and were required to pick at least three players from the emerging category. The squads for the 2023 season were announced in December 2022.

* Islamabad United: Shadab Khan (c), Asif Ali, Hasan Ali, Faheem Ashraf, Muhammad Akhlaq, Colin Munro, Paul Stirling, Alex Hales, Rahmanullah Gurbaz, Mubasir Khan, Zeeshan Zameer, Shadab Majeed, Moeen Ali, Fazalhaq Farooqi, Abrar Ahmed, Sohail Tanvir, Rumman Raees, Zafar Gohar
* Karachi Kings: Imad Wasim (c), Babar Azam, Muhammad Amir, Chris Jordan, Lewis Gregory, Umaid Asif, Sharjeel Khan, Qasim Akram, Imran Tahir, Aqeel Anjum, Irfan Khan, Tabraiz Shamsi, Faisal Akram, Romario Shepherd, James Vince, James Fuller, Andrew Tye, Haider Ali
* Lahore Qalandars: Shaheen Afridi (c), Rashid Khan, David Wiese, Liam Dawson, Bopara, Harry Brook, Phil Salt, Ahmed Daniyal, Sohail Akhtar, Fakhar Zaman, Abdullah Shafique, Kamran Ghulam, Zaman Khan, Maaz Khan, Syed Faridoun, Imran Randhawa, Ahsan Bhatti, Shawaiz Irfan
* Multan Sultans: Mohammad Rizwan (c), Rilee Rossouw, Shan Masood, Khushdil Shah, Tim David, David Miller, Anwar Ali, Rovman Powell, Rumman Raees, Asma-ul-Haq, Abbas Afridi, Arafat Minhas, Ihsanullah, Shahnawaz Dahani, Sameen Gul, Akeal Hosein, Usman Khan, Kieron Pollard
* Peshawar Zalmi: Babar Azam (c), Tom Kohler-Cadmore, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Rovman Powell, Mujeeb Ur Rahman, Sherfane Rutherford, Wahab Riaz, Arshad Iqbal, Salman Irshad, Usman Qadir, Saim Ayub, Haseebullah Khan, Suhaan Khan, James Neesham, Khurram Shahzad, Arish Ali Khan, Danish Aziz, Yasir Khan
* Quetta Gladiators: Sarfaraz Ahmed (c), Mohammad Nawaz, Iftikhar Ahmed, Jason Roy, Martin Guptill, Naseem Shah, Mohammad Hasnain, Ahsan Ali, Umar Akmal, Abdul Bangalzai, Qais Ahmad, Ashir Qureshi, Ali Imran, Ghulam Mudassar, Mohammad Zahid, Omair Yousuf, Aimal Khan

# Venues

The 2023 Pakistan Super League was played at four venues in Pakistan. The Karachi Kings and Multan Sultans played their home matches at the National Bank Cricket Arena in Karachi and the Multan Cricket Stadium in Multan, respectively. The Lahore Qalandars played their home matches at the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore, while the Islamabad United played their home matches at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium in Rawalpindi.

# Match officials

## Umpires

The PCB appointed a panel of umpires to officiate in the 2023 Pakistan Super League. The panel included:

* Roshan Mahanama
* Russell Adams

# Marketing

The PCB launched a marketing campaign for the 2023 Pakistan Super League, which included a new logo and branding for the tournament. The campaign was designed to promote the tournament and attract new fans to the league. The PCB also partnered with several sponsors to support the tournament, including Habib Bank, Tapal Tea, and Caltex.

# Trophy

The winner of the 2023 Pakistan Super League received the Habib Bank Trophy, which was designed by the PCB and manufactured by a local company.

# League stage

The 2023 Pakistan Super League featured a double round-robin league stage, with each team playing 10 matches. The top four teams qualified for the playoffs.

## Format

The league stage was played in a double round-robin format, with each team playing 10 matches. The teams were awarded points as follows:

* Win: 2 points

article:
Liz Truss
================

Mary Elizabeth Truss, known as Liz Truss, is a British politician who served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from September 6, 2022, to October 25, 2022. She has been the Member of Parliament (MP) for South West Norfolk since 2010. Truss is a member of the Conservative Party and has held various cabinet positions in the governments of David Cameron, Theresa May, and Boris Johnson.

Early life and education (1975–1996)
------------------------------------

Liz Truss was born on July 26, 1975, in Oxford, England. She is the daughter of John Kenneth Truss, a professor of mathematics, and Priscilla Mary (née Grasby), a nurse and teacher. Truss's parents were both Labour Party supporters, and her father was a member of the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament. She has three younger brothers.

Truss was educated at Roundhay School, a comprehensive school in Leeds, West Yorkshire. She was a student at the University of Oxford, where she studied Philosophy, Politics, and Economics (PPE) at Merton College. During her time at Oxford, Truss was active in the Liberal Democrats and served as the president of the Oxford University Liberal Democrats. She graduated in 1996.

Career
--------

### Employment and candidatures (1996–2010)

After graduating from Oxford, Truss worked in the energy and telecommunications industries. She was a senior economist at Shell and later worked as a deputy director at the think tank Reform. Truss was also a member of the Conservative Party's policy advisory board.

In 2001, Truss stood as the Conservative candidate for Hemsworth, a Labour-held seat in West Yorkshire. She lost the election but stood again in 2005 for Calder Valley, where she lost again. Truss was finally elected as the MP for South West Norfolk in 2010.

### Backbencher (2010–2012)

As a backbencher, Truss was a member of the Free Enterprise Group of Conservative MPs, which advocated for free market policies. She also served on the Justice Select Committee and the Education Select Committee. Truss was a vocal critic of the coalition government's education policies and argued for greater autonomy for schools.

### Education under-secretary (2012–2014)

In 2012, Truss was appointed as the Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Education and Childcare. She was responsible for implementing the government's education reforms, including the introduction of free schools and the expansion of academies. Truss also worked on improving childcare provision and reducing bureaucracy in schools.

### Environment secretary (2014–2016)

In 2014, Truss was appointed as the Secretary of State for Environment, Food, and Rural Affairs. She was responsible for the government's policies on the environment, agriculture, and rural affairs. Truss was a strong advocate for the UK's farming industry and argued for greater support for farmers. She also worked on improving the UK's animal welfare standards and reducing food waste.

### Justice secretary and lord chancellor (2016–2017)

In 2016, Truss was appointed as the Secretary of State for Justice and Lord Chancellor. She was responsible for the government's policies on justice, law, and order. Truss was a strong advocate for prison reform and argued for greater support for victims of crime. She also worked on improving the UK's courts system and reducing bureaucracy in the justice system.

### Chief secretary to the Treasury (2017–2019)

In 2017, Truss was appointed as the Chief Secretary to the Treasury. She was responsible for the government's public finances and worked closely with the Chancellor of the Exchequer. Truss was a strong advocate for reducing public spending and argued for greater efficiency in government.

### International trade secretary (2019–2021)

In 2019, Truss was appointed as the Secretary of State for International Trade. She was responsible for the UK's trade policies and worked on negotiating new trade agreements with countries around the world. Truss was a strong advocate for free trade and argued for greater liberalization of trade.

### Foreign secretary (2021–2022)

In 2021, Truss was appointed as the Secretary of State for Foreign, Commonwealth, and Development Affairs. She was responsible for the UK's foreign policy and worked on promoting British interests around the world. Truss was a strong advocate for the UK's role in global affairs and argued for greater support for democracy and human rights.

#### Leadership election (July–September 2022)

In July 2022, Truss announced her candidacy for the leadership of the Conservative Party, following the resignation of Boris Johnson. She campaigned on a platform of tax cuts, deregulation, and greater support for business. Truss won the leadership election in September 2022, defeating Rishi Sunak.

Premiership (2022)
-----------------

### Cabinet and death of Elizabeth II

Truss formed her cabinet in September 2022, appointing Kwasi Kwarteng as Chancellor of the Exchequer and James Cleverly as Foreign Secretary. She also appointed Thérèse Coffey as Deputy Prime Minister and Secretary of State for Health and Social Care. Truss's premiership was marked by the death of Queen Elizabeth II on September 8, 2022. She was succeeded by King Charles III.

### Domestic policies and mini-budget

Truss's government introduced a series of domestic policies, including tax cuts and deregulation. The government also introduced a mini-budget, which included measures to reduce energy bills and support businesses. However, the mini-budget was criticized for its impact on public finances and its potential to exacerbate inequality.

### Government crisis and resignation

Truss's premiership was marked by a series of crises, including a decline in the value of the pound and a rise in interest rates. The government faced criticism for its handling of the economy and its impact on public services. In October 2022, Truss announced her resignation as Prime Minister, following a vote of no confidence by Conservative MPs. She was succeeded by Rishi Sunak.

Post-premiership (2022–present)
------------------------------

Since her resignation, Truss has remained a member of Parliament and has continued to advocate for her policies. She has also written articles and given speeches on politics and economics.

Political positions
-------------------

### Domestic issues

Truss is a strong advocate for free market policies and has argued for greater deregulation and tax cuts. She has also argued for greater support for business and entrepreneurship. Truss has been critical of the UK's public sector and has argued for greater efficiency in government.

### Foreign policy

Truss is a strong advocate for the UK's role in global affairs and has argued for greater support for democracy and human rights. She has also argued for greater cooperation with other countries on issues such as trade and security. Truss has been critical of authoritarian regimes and has argued for greater support for opponents of these regimes.

Indonesia at the 2022 Asian Games

The 2022 Asian Games, officially known as the XIX Asiad, is a pan-Asian multi-sport event scheduled to take place in Hangzhou, Zhejiang, China from September 10 to September 25, 2022. Indonesia is one of the participating nations in the Games.

Background

### Administration

The Indonesian Asian Games contingent is organized by the Indonesian Olympic Committee (KOI) in collaboration with the Ministry of Youth and Sports. The Chef de Mission (CdM) of the Indonesian contingent is Ferry J. Kono.

### Flag bearers

The flag bearers for Indonesia at the opening ceremony were Greysia Polii and Mohammad Ahsan, both badminton players who won gold medals at the 2020 Summer Olympics.

### Broadcasters

Competitors

article:
Forbidden Door (2022)
=====================

Forbidden Door was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by All Elite Wrestling (AEW) and New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW). It took place on June 26, 2022, at the United Center in Chicago, Illinois.

Production
----------

### Background

In September 2020, AEW and NJPW announced a working relationship, which led to a series of collaborative events and matches. The Forbidden Door event was first mentioned in November 2021, with AEW President Tony Khan stating that it would be a significant show for both promotions. The event was officially announced in April 2022, with the United Center in Chicago being revealed as the host venue.

### Storylines

The event featured a number of high-profile matches, including several interpromotional bouts between AEW and NJPW wrestlers. The main event saw Jon Moxley face Hiroshi Tanahashi for the interim AEW World Championship, while the co-main event featured Jay White defending the IWGP World Heavyweight Championship against Kazuchika Okada, Adam Cole, and Hangman Page in a four-way match.

Event
-----

### The Buy-In

The event began with a pre-show, known as The Buy-In, which featured a match between Keith Lee and Swerve Strickland. Lee emerged victorious, pinning Strickland after a Spirit Bomb.

### Preliminary matches

The first match of the main card saw Max Caster and Gunn Club (Austin Gunn and Colten Gunn) face Los Ingobernables de Japón (Tetsuya Naito, Sanada, and Bushi) in a six-man tag team match. The match ended with Naito pinning Caster after a Destino.

Next, Thunder Rosa defended her AEW Women's World Championship against Toni Storm. Rosa emerged victorious, pinning Storm after a Fire Thunder Driver.

The third match saw Eddie Kingston face Tomohiro Ishii in a hard-hitting match. Kingston emerged victorious, pinning Ishii after a Backfist to the Future.

The fourth match saw Dax Harwood and Cash Wheeler face Great-O-Khan and Aaron Henare in a tag team match. Harwood and Wheeler emerged victorious, pinning Henare after a BTE Trigger.

The fifth match saw Orange Cassidy face Will Ospreay in a singles match. Ospreay emerged victorious, pinning Cassidy after a Stormbreaker.

The sixth match saw Darby Allin and Sting face Jeff Jarrett and Jay Lethal in a tag team match. Allin and Sting emerged victorious, pinning Lethal after a Scorpion Death Drop.

### Main event

The main event saw Jon Moxley face Hiroshi Tanahashi for the interim AEW World Championship. Moxley emerged victorious, pinning Tanahashi after a Paradigm Shift.

Aftermath
----------

The event received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the high-quality matches and the successful collaboration between AEW and NJPW. The event also set a new record for AEW's highest-grossing event, with over $1 million in revenue.

article:
Taylor Lorenz

Taylor Lorenz is an American journalist and technology reporter who has gained a significant following and recognition for her reporting on internet culture, social media, and technology trends. Her work has been featured in various prominent publications, and she has become a prominent voice in the conversation around the intersection of technology and society.

#Early life and education

Taylor Lorenz was born and raised in New York City. She developed an interest in technology and the internet from a young age and was active on various online platforms during her teenage years. Lorenz pursued higher education at the University of Colorado Boulder, where she earned a degree in journalism.

After completing her undergraduate studies, Lorenz began her career in journalism, working as an intern at several publications before eventually landing a full-time position as a reporter.

#Career

##The Washington Post

Lorenz began her career as a journalist at The Washington Post, where she worked as a technology reporter covering the intersection of technology and culture. During her time at the Post, Lorenz wrote extensively on topics such as social media, online trends, and the impact of technology on society.

Her reporting at the Post helped establish her as a prominent voice in the technology journalism space, and she quickly gained a reputation for her insightful and engaging coverage of the tech industry.

##Independent journalism

In addition to her work at The Washington Post, Lorenz has also written for various other publications, including The New York Times, The Atlantic, and The Verge. Her independent reporting has allowed her to explore a wide range of topics, from the rise of influencer culture to the impact of social media on mental health.

Lorenz's work has been widely praised for its nuance and depth, and she has become known for her ability to balance technical explanations with accessible language and compelling storytelling.

#Harassment and coordinated attacks

As a prominent journalist covering the tech industry, Lorenz has faced harassment and coordinated attacks from various groups and individuals. She has been the target of online abuse, hate mail, and even death threats, often in response to her reporting on sensitive topics such as online extremism and harassment.

Despite these challenges, Lorenz has continued to speak out against online harassment and has advocated for greater accountability and transparency in the tech industry. Her work has helped raise awareness about the need for greater protections and support for journalists and other individuals who are vulnerable to online abuse.

#Personal life

Lorenz is active on social media and has a significant following on platforms such as Twitter and Instagram. She is known for her engaging and often humorous commentary on technology and internet culture, and has become a beloved figure among many in the tech journalism community.

In her free time, Lorenz enjoys exploring new technologies and online platforms, and is an avid reader of science fiction and fantasy novels.

#Selected publications

* "The Meme Generation" (The Washington Post, 2019)
* "The Rise of the Influencer" (The New York Times, 2020)
* "The Dark Side of Social Media" (The Atlantic, 2020)
* "The Future of Tech Journalism" (The Verge, 2020)

#Notes

This article is a biographical summary of Taylor Lorenz's life and career, and is intended to provide a general overview of her work and achievements.

#References

None.

#External links

None.
